review_title: A highly recommended budget accommodation in Baños
review_text_liked: The location was excellent. The hosteria is on a hillside, offering a beautiful mountain view across the town and the valley. At the same time the location is also central, only 10 minutes by foot from the main square and 12 minutes from the bus station (Terminal Terrestre). Our room was clean and comfortable, with two queen beds with four(!) soft pillows. The bathroom had hot water for showering. Normally the room is cleaned every day (they ask if you wish that they do). The breakfast was very good. It consisted of eggs, bread rolls, butter and marmalade with juice and coffee - which is what you normally get for breakfast in Ecuador. But the juice was different every day, the croissants were served warm (not every day, though) and the eggs were prepared in a different way. This is actually a big deal if you've been traveling for a long time. We had established a contact with the hosteria in WhatsApp before arrival and received all possible information regarding our stay in advance. Someone was around and available 24/7, opening the gate and supporting the clients with information about activities etc. We had our laundry done for a very small amount of money that was less than in public laundries. We did not speak Spanish, so were happy to find that the staff spoke varying levels of English. You get a great value for the money you pay.
review_text_disliked: The only downside was the wifi signal that was a bit weak the room (but much better behind the door). After a month of wandering around Ecuador, I know that this is completely normal and you can expect good wifi only in large cities.

review_text_disliked: Internet did not work. It was incredibly slow and often stopped. I usually turned it off and used mobile data instead. The hotel is directly above Plaza 5 de Junio, which, the second night I stayed, had a large, community gathering, with speeches blaring on megaphones until 1am, which made it impossible to sleep. A pipe burst in my room, soaking all my things. It was like a waterfall going down the stairs when I returned. The hotel changed my room, and reluctantly offered to dry, not wash, my soaked (formerly clean) clothing. They did a poor job of this and did not unpair my socks, so all my socks were mildewed when I received them back, and my other clothes now smelled musty from sitting in standing water for so long. My backpack was soaked for a couple of days and a couple of medications were also damaged. More grating, upon checkout the hotel acted like they did me a favor for not charging me for drying my clothes, changing my room, and not charging me for a guest my second night. I didn't want a discount, accidents happen, but their response was insulting. They poorly dried clothes that were soaked by their failed plumbing, and the hotel charges the same for a room on all sites, whether there is one guest or two.

They had good accessibility ramps to all of the room which you enter from outside rather than a hallway so it made it really easy to roll your bags to the room. They have free parking and it's gated so we felt like our things were safe. The staff were so lovely, especially the older man in the restaurant who happily let us use hot water for noodles and provided utensils without us asking. The hotel is a couple of blocks up a steep hill so I liked having to walk up hill a short while after having a meal in town!
review_text_disliked: The biggest downside, which isn't a fault of the owner, is that it is SO LOUD! Banos seems to have music pumping until about 2-3am, then a rooster goes between 3-5am, then a marching band started at 5am the whole stay haha. I had earplugs so was fine but my boyfriend didn't and barely slept. So if you are a light sleeper I suggest earplugs or booking somewhere further out of town.

review_text_liked: Es una queja grande al establecimiento y a Booking, se produjo un caso de estafa, los precios y la calidad del servicio fueron engañosos, en las habitaciones indica que el precio en temporada alta es de $20 más IVA y en temporada baja $10 más IVA, curiosamente Booking en su página ofrece el lugar con un valor de $58,50, como es posible que dicha página se preste para el engaño, los precios de los establecimientos se encuentran regulados por las autoridades locales, sin embargo hubo engaño total en la reserva, incluso a pesar de que en la página decía que se pagará en el establecimiento, el mismo me exigió el pago antes de mi arribo a la ciudad de baños de agua santa, precisamente para cobrar un valor que sus instalaciones no la tiene, el lugar establece los precios en un letrero ubicado en la puerta de cada habitación, por ser cliente frecuente de Booking y tener Nivel Genius 3 por la frecuencia de reservas qué tñrealizo por esta página, es la primera vez que ello ha ocurrido, por lo que agradeceré se reintegre el valor cobrado en exceso ya que la calidad del establecimiento, no permite un cobro mayor a un valor a $20, espero una respuesta por parte de Booking en el menor tiempo posible.para solucionar este inconveniente, por cuanto el establecimiento no dio ninguna respuesta al reclamo realizado el mismo día del hospedaje, por el engaño sufrido...
